candidates.name: Dune
candidates.bio: Dune is a 1965 science-fiction novel by American author Frank Herbert, originally published as two separate serials in Analog magazine.

candidates.name: Snow Crash
candidates.bio: Snow Crash is a science fiction novel by American writer Neal Stephenson, published in 1992.

candidates.name: The Three Body Problem
candidates.bio: The Three-Body Problem (Chinese: 三体; lit. 'Three-Body'; pinyin: sān tǐ) is a science fiction novel by the Chinese writer Liu Cixin.

candidates.name: The Left Hand of Darkness
candidates.bio: The Left Hand of Darkness is a science fiction novel by U.S. writer Ursula K. Le Guin. Published in 1969, it became immensely popular, and established Le Guin's status as a major author of science fiction.

candidates.name: Neuromancer
candidates.bio: Neuromancer is a 1984 science fiction novel by American-Canadian writer William Gibson. It is one of the best-known works in the cyberpunk genre and the only novel to win the Nebula Award, the Philip K. Dick Award, and the Hugo Award.

candidates.name: Roadside Picnic
candidates.bio: Roadside Picnic (Russian: Пикник на обочине, Piknik na obochine, IPA: [pʲɪkˈnʲik nɐ ɐˈbotɕɪnʲe]) is a philosophical science fiction novel by Soviet-Russian authors Arkady and Boris Strugatsky, written in 1971 and published in 1972.
